FAQ_start:
1. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

You can contact our support team:
FAQ_text:
1.1. What data is required for registration?

To register, you only need a mobile phone number, to which you will receive an SMS with a code to confirm registration.

1.2. Why enter the transport field?

The transport field is optional, it is used for the convenience of the User and helps him to obtain additional information about the time of using the Operator's charging infrastructure.

1.3. Where are the charging stations?

You can connect to any smart socket indicated on the card in the mobile application. Also in the application, you can find out the status of the outlet: green - free, yellow busy, red will be available after the end of maintenance or repair work.

1.4. What should I do if my phone is dead?

If you have already connected to the outlet, then it's okay, as soon as it ends, you can leave, the session will automatically end after removing the plug from the outlet. If you have not started charging yet, then you need to use a working phone with the application installed. You can also activate a nearby power outlet and use it to recharge your phone.
FAQ_text_second:
1.5. I enjoyed using it, how can I put the same one in my yard?

You can contact us via
FAQ_text_third: and suggest locations and areas for the installation of new smart poles and smart plugs. We will be grateful for this information and will use it to include it in plans to modernize the infrastructure located in a location convenient for you.
privacy_policy_text_3:
marked “Withdrawal of consent to the processing of personal data”.

 

7. Cross-border transfer of personal data

7.1. Before starting the cross-border transfer of personal data, the operator must make sure that the foreign state, to whose territory it is supposed to transfer personal data, provides reliable protection of the rights of subjects of personal data.

7.2. Cross-border transfer of personal data on the territory of foreign states that do not meet the above requirements can be carried out only if there is a written consent of the subject of personal data to the cross-border transfer of his personal data and / or the execution of an agreement to which the subject of personal data is a party.

 

8. Service 'RECURRENT CHARGES' AND METHOD OF ITS ACTIVATION

8.1 The service "Recurring debits" allows the User to pay for the Supplier's Services under the Agreement by means of regular automatic transfers of funds in favor of the Supplier from Bank cards. Activation (connection) of the Service "Recurring write-offs" involves the following actions:

8.1.1 In the Personal Account in the Supplier's application, the User selects the section: "Settings", subsection "Bank Cards"; By adding a card, the user automatically agrees with this Agreement for the use of the Service "Recurrent write-offs". Service "Recurring debits" is connected only for the Bank card registered by the Cardholder.

8.2 Action of the Service "Recurring write-offs"

8.2.1. After connecting the Service "Recurring Debit", funds will be transferred from the Bank Card in the time and amount necessary for the proper fulfillment of the User's obligations under the Agreement.

8.2.2. Direct debiting of funds is carried out by the Issuing Bank on the basis of the User's prior consent to such a write-off in the amount and within the period specified in the Agreement. A request for a transfer of funds with an indication of the amount of transfer to the Issuing Bank is submitted by the Bank and the Processing Center within the framework of the agreements concluded with the Supplier.

8.2.3. At one time, the User can activate (connect) the Service "Recurring Debit" only for one Bank card of the payment system Visa (Visa Inc.), MasterCard or Maestro (MasterCard International Inc.).

8.2.4. The Supplier does not store or process the data of the Users' bank cards, as well as other personal data of the Users, providing only requests to the Processing Center and the Bank for the repeated operation of the User's bank card.

8.2.5. The Supplier does not guarantee the possibility of carrying out transactions with the Bank Card.

8.2.6. The user guarantees that he is the holder of a bank card,

deliberately, correctly and completely enters all the required details of the Bank Card when activating (connecting) the "Recurring Debit" Service.

8.2.7. The performance by the User of actions in the personal account of the application is recognized as an analogue of the User's handwritten signature.

8.2.8. Connection of the Service "Recurrent write-offs", in the manner prescribed by this Agreement for the use of the service, is carried out only if there is a technical capability of the Supplier, the Processing Center, the Bank, the Issuing Bank. The Supplier, the Processing Center, the Bank are not responsible for the impossibility of connecting the Service "Recurring Debit".

8.2.9. The Supplier has the right to amend this Agreement for the use of the service by notifying the User in writing in advance either in another accessible way, including by sending an SMS message to the number specified in the Agreement by the User, or by posting information on the Supplier's Website.

8.3 Disabling the Service "Recurring write-offs"

8.3.1. Disconnection (refusal) of the User from the Service "Recurrent Debit" occurs: In the "Personal Account" the User selects the section "Settings", subsection "Add a card". Presses the button to remove the card. At the same time, the funds transferred from the Bank Card before the User is disconnected (refused) from the Recurring Debit Service for the Services will not be returned to the User.

8.3.2. In case of insufficient funds on the Bank Card account for making a transfer, the Supplier has the right to repeat the request to write off funds from the Bank Card.

8.4 Restrictions when using the Service "Recurring Debit"

8.4.1. no more than 5 (five) transfers per day can be made from one Bank Card;

8.4.2. from one Bank card, a transfer can be made for no more than 15,000 rubles per transaction;

8.4.3. transfers from one Bank card can be made for no more than 50,000 rubles per day;

8.4.4. transition to the "Order History" page is possible only if the User has an Internet connection, regardless of the current state of the account.

8.4.5 Funds can be debited only after the service has been provided.

8.5 Responsibilities of the parties

8.5.1. The Supplier, the Processing Center, the Bank is not responsible for the inoperability and / or temporary inoperability of the Recurring Debit Service. The User independently controls the fulfillment of his obligation to pay for the Services. In case of inoperability and / or temporary inoperability of the Service "Recurring Debit", the User is obliged to use other methods of fulfilling obligations to pay for the Services.

8.5.2. Disputes between the parties arising in connection with the fulfillment of the terms of this Agreement are resolved in the course of filing claims. If the Parties fail to reach mutual agreement, disputes between them are resolved in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation.

8.6 OTHER CONDITIONS

8.6.1. Performing actions to connect the Service "Recurrent write-offs":

A) The user unconditionally agrees with all the terms of this Agreement.

B) The User gives in advance this acceptance for the withdrawal of funds by the Supplier from the Bank Card on the terms of this Agreement.

C) The User grants the right to the Processing Center, the Bank to store, collect, process his personal data (Surname, Name, Patronymic, passport series and number, place and date of birth, current account and Bank card number) in order to implement this Agreement.

D) The User agrees to pay for the Services in accordance with the terms of the Agreement.

8.6.2 The User unconditionally agrees with this Agreement for the use of the service by performing implicit actions to connect the Service "Recurrent write-offs" at the time the User accepts this service agreement and perform actions to activate the Service "Recurrent write-offs".

8.6.3. The Provider has the right to disconnect and / or restrict the User from the Service

9. Final provisions

9.1. The user can receive any clarifications on issues of interest regarding the processing of his personal data by contacting the Operator via e-mail info@quloncharge.ru.

9.2. This document will reflect any changes in the personal data processing policy by the Operator. The policy is valid indefinitely until it is replaced by a new version.

9.3. The current version of the Policy is freely available in the Kepler InfoPanel mobile application on the Privacy Policy page.
user_guide_text:
It is easy to use the city infrastructure to recharge electric vehicles or connect other power consumers:

1. Open the mobile application "Kepler InfoPanel" and scan the QR code next to the outlet
2. Press the "Switch on" button (the outlet will be supplied with electricity from 220V to 3.5kW)
3. Remove the plug from the socket, the session will be automatically terminated, the cost of the consumed electricity will be debited from your account in the application.
4. To re-supply electricity, follow step 2

If you don't have a mobile app yet, just scan the QR code next to the outlet to install it. Registration is carried out using the SMS code sent to your mobile phone number.

After registration, you will have a personal account and an account to which you can credit the selected amount using a bank card or other payment systems.
